snippet: Significant political ramifications could unfold from a scandal in which William E. Rapfogel, the former leader of the Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty,  is accused of padding insurance payments.
abstract: Scandal surrounding William E Rapfogel, former leader of Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty accused of padding insurance payments and giving some of the money to politicians who supply government grants to nonprofits, has potential for major political ramifications; Rapfogel has close personal relationship with New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver; scandal, which came to light from anonymous whistle-blower, is latest example of remarkable lack of oversight of nonprofit groups that receive grants of taxpayer money.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: Significant political ramifications could unfold from a scandal in which William E. Rapfogel, the former leader of the Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty,  is accused of padding insurance payments.

headline.main: Whistle-Blower’s Letter Led to Charity’s Firing of Chief Executive
headline.print_headline: A Whistle-Blower’s Letter Led to a Charity’s Firing of Its Chief Executive

keywords.value: Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty
keywords.name: organizations
